description: From Latin ēgregius, from e- (“out of”), + grex (“flock”), + English adjective suffix -ous, from Latin suffix -osus (“full of”); reflecting the positive connotations of "standing out from the flock".

adjectives.description: egregious (comparative more egregious, superlative most egregious)

entries.meaning: Conspicuous, exceptional, outstanding; usually in a negative sense.
examples: The student has made egregious errors on the examination.
